news.Bericht: Milan vor Verpflichtung von Che: {"short": "Chelsea's Ruben Loftus-Cheek set to join AC Milan for €16M + bonuses, the first foreign club for the 27-year-old midfielder. AC Milan also eyeing Lazio's Luka Romero, Atalanta's Marco Sportiello, and others.", "middle": "AC Milan looks to bolster their squad with several new signings, including Chelsea's Ruben Loftus-Cheek for €16M + bonuses, and potentially Christian Pulisic, Samuel Chukwueze, Gianluca Scamacca, and Atlético's Álvaro Morata. The club has already signed Zlatan Ibrahimović for the upcoming season, but the 39-year-old is expected to retire soon.", "long": "AC Milan is making a push to strengthen their team with a number of high-profile signings, starting with Chelsea's Ruben Loftus-Cheek for a reported €16 million plus bonuses. This would be the first time the 27-year-old midfielder has played for a foreign club, and the second time Chelsea has profited from transfers this summer. The Rossoneri are also eyeing several other talented players, including Lazio's Luka Romero and Atalanta's Marco Sportiello, both of whom are on free transfers. Additionally, the club is reportedly interested in securing the services of Christian Pulisic, Samuel Chukwueze of Villarreal, Gianluca Scamacca of West Ham, and Atlético's player Álvaro Morata. Morata is said to have an exit clause of 10 million Euros in his contract, set to expire in 2024. So far, AC Milan has made only one official transfer for the upcoming season, with Zlatan Ibrahimović moving towards retirement."}

From his birthplace in Valdagno to the football fields of the world, Lazzari has left an indelible mark, haunting the fields with his talent and dedication. news.Lazio verl\u00e4ngert vorzeitig mit Rech: {"short": "Lazio extends Lazzari's contract for 3 more years until 2027.", "middle": "Lazio and Manuel Lazzari have agreed on a three-year contract extension, keeping the right-back with the Serie A's fourth-placed team until 2027. Lazzari joined Lazio in 2019 for 15 million euros and has made 134 appearances for the club, contributing to 20 goals.", "long": "Lazio Roma has locked in Manuel Lazzari for another three years, keeping the talented right-back with the club until 2027. This contract extension comes as no surprise, given Lazzari's impressive performance for the Serie A's fourth-placed team since joining in 2019 for 15 million euros. In just two seasons, Lazzari has made 134 appearances for Lazio and has been involved in 20 goals. His current market value of 15 million euros is only surpassed by five other players in the Roman squad, a testament to his value to the team. With this extension, Lazio is demonstrating its commitment to maintaining a strong and stable squad, and fans can look forward to seeing Lazzari continue to shine for the club in the years to come."}
news.Mancini streicht Septett um Grifo und Ke: {"short": "Italy's national team will be without Vincenzo Grifo from SC Freiburg for the European Championship this summer. Coach Roberto Mancini has announced the 28-man squad, which includes Jorginho and Emerson from FC Chelsea. The team will assemble in Rome on Monday and prepare at the national training center in Florence before facing the Czech Republic in a friendly match on Friday and opening against Turkey on June 11.", "middle": "Italy's national team will be without several key players, including Vincenzo Grifo from SC Freiburg, Moise Kean from Paris Saint-Germain, and Alessio Cragno, Cristiano Biraghi, Gaetano Castrovilli, Manuel Lazzari, and Giacomo Raspadori. However, the team will be led by experienced defenders Giorgio Chiellini and Leonardo Bonucci from Juventus, as well as midfielder Marco Verratti from PSG, who has recently recovered from an injury. The team will assemble in Rome on Monday and prepare at the national training center in Florence before facing the Czech Republic in a friendly match on Friday and opening against Turkey on June 11.", "long": "Italy's national team will be without several key players for the European Championship this summer, including Vincenzo Grifo from SC Freiburg, Moise Kean from Paris Saint-Germain, and several other notable players. However, the team will be led by experienced defenders Giorgio Chiellini and Leonardo Bonucci from Juventus, as well as midfielder Marco Verratti from PSG, who has recently recovered from an injury. The team will assemble in Rome on Monday and prepare at the national training center in Florence before facing the Czech Republic in a friendly match on Friday and opening against Turkey on June 11. The team's 28-man squad includes Jorginho and Emerson from FC Chelsea, as well as other talented players such as Gianluigi Donnarumma, Alessandro Florenzi, Lorenzo Insigne, Federico Bernardeschi, and youngsters Nicolò Barella, Lorenzo Pellegrini, and Federico Chiesa. The team will be looking to make a strong showing in the tournament, which will be held in Group A alongside Switzerland and Wales."}

The 35-year-old center-back has been a vital member of the Nerazzurri squad since joining on loan in 2020, and has now signed a permanent deal with the club. Acerbi has a wealth of experience in Serie A, having played a total of 353 games, with 186 of them under current coach Simone Inzaghi. This move solidifies Inter Milan's defense and demonstrates their commitment to building a strong squad for the upcoming season."}

Inzaghi is now the coach of Inter Milan, and he's brought Acerbi along with him on loan from Lazio Rome until the end of the season. Interestingly, Inter has a purchase option of 3.5 million euros for the Italian European champion in the summer of 2023. Acerbi has been the defensive chief under Inzaghi at Lazio since 2018, but his successor Maurizio Sarri has recently favored other players in the central defense. This move marks a homecoming for the player, and it will be interesting to see how he performs in this familiar environment.

player_transfer_2.short: Lazio loans out Cataldi to Benevento for more playing time on July 19, 2017.
player_transfer_2.middle: On July 19, 2017, Lazio made the decision to loan out Cataldi to Benevento in search of more playing time for their player.
player_transfer_2.long: On a sunny day in July, specifically the 19th, Lazio made the strategic move to loan out one of their players, Cataldi, to Benevento. This decision was likely made with the intention of providing Cataldi with more playing time and an opportunity to grow as a player. This move not only benefits Cataldi but also allows Lazio to continue to strengthen their roster with a diverse range of talented players.

player_transfer_3.short: Cataldi moved from Genoa to Lazio in July.
player_transfer_3.middle: In July, Cataldi made a transfer from Genoa to Lazio, but the details of the move are not known.
player_transfer_3.long: In the middle of the year, on July 1st to be exact, Cataldi made a significant move from Genoa back to Lazio. While the details of this transfer are not publicly disclosed, it's clear that this move was a big deal for both teams and their fans. As a player, Cataldi brings a wealth of experience and skill to the field, and we can't wait to see how he'll perform in his new role.

player_transfer_4.short: Cataldi loaned out by Lazio to Genoa in 2017 for more exposure.
player_transfer_4.middle: Lazio loaned out Cataldi to Genoa on January 13th, 2017, to give the player more exposure and gain experience.
player_transfer_4.long: Lazio, looking to provide one of their promising young players with more exposure and experience, loaned out Cataldi to Genoa on January 13th, 2017. This move allowed the player to gain valuable playing time and develop their skills in a different environment, all with the hope of eventually returning to Lazio stronger and more prepared for the challenges of top-level football.

player_transfer_5.short: Cataldi returned to Lazio after a successful loan spell at Crotone on July 1st, 2014.
player_transfer_5.middle: Lazio recalled Cataldi from his loan spell at Crotone on July 1st, 2014, following a successful stint with the club.
player_transfer_5.long: After a fruitful loan spell at Crotone, Lazio decided to bring Cataldi back into the fold on July 1st, 2014, a move that was met with great excitement from the club's faithful fans.

player_transfer_6.short: Cataldi's career started with a loan to Crotone in 2013.
player_transfer_6.middle: Cataldi began his professional journey with a loan to Crotone from Lazio on August 7th, 2013.
player_transfer_6.long: Cataldi's path to becoming a seasoned footballer began with a loan move to Crotone from Lazio on August 7th, 2013. This was just the starting point for his journeyman career, one that would take him to various clubs and test his mettle in the beautiful game.

news.Neben Leipzig auch Atalanta, FC Sevilla: {"short": "RB Leipzig, Atalanta BC, FC Porto, and FC Sevilla advance to the round of 16 in the Europa League. Atalanta thrashed Olympiakos 3:0, while Porto and Sevilla had closer matches with 2:2 and 1:0 scores, respectively.", "middle": "In the Europa League, four teams have made it to the round of 16, including RB Leipzig, Atalanta BC, FC Porto, and FC Sevilla. Atalanta had an easy win over Olympiakos Piraeus with a 3:0 score, while Porto and Sevilla had more challenging matches with 2:2 and 1:0 scores, respectively. Despite losing to Dinamo Zagreb, Sevilla advanced thanks to their earlier victory. Thomas Delaney was given a yellow-red card for Porto in injury time, and Ciro Immobile scored for Lazio Rome, but Mehdi Taremi and Mateus Uribe turned the game in Porto's favor.", "long": "The Europa League round of 16 is set, with RB Leipzig, Atalanta BC, FC Porto, and FC Sevilla all advancing to the next round. Atalanta had a dominant performance over Olympiakos Piraeus, thrashing them 3:0 with Ruslan Malinovskyi scoring twice and making a statement with a T-shirt protest against the Russian invasion of his home country, Ukraine. Joakim Maehle also scored for the Lombards. Despite losing 1:0 to Dinamo Zagreb, Sevilla made it through thanks to their earlier 3:1 victory, but not without some drama as Thomas Delaney was given a yellow-red card in injury time. Porto secured a 2:2 draw against Lazio Rome, with Ciro Immobile putting the Italians ahead, but Mehdi Taremi and Mateus Uribe turning the game in Porto's favor. Danilo Cataldi could only secure a draw for Lazio in the 94th minute."}
news.Rom verleiht Cataldi an Benevento Calcio: {"short": "Lazio's Danilo Cataldi heads to Benevento on loan for 2 million Euros with a purchase option", "middle": "Midfielder Danilo Cataldi leaves Lazio Roma for Benevento Calcio on loan deal worth 2 million Euros, including a compulsory purchase clause of 5 million Euros and a buy-back option for Roma at 10 million Euros", "long": "Lazio's talented midfielder Danilo Cataldi is making a move to Benevento Calcio on loan, with the deal worth 2 million Euros. This includes a compulsory purchase clause of 5 million Euros, should Benevento decide to make the move permanent. Additionally, Roma has secured a buy-back option for 10 million Euros, should they wish to bring Cataldi back to the squad in the future."}

short.Player Name: Elseid Hysaj, one of Albania's finest football talents.

middle.Player Age: Hysaj, at 29, is in his prime, showcasing agility and strategy on the field.

long.Birth Info: Born on February 2nd, 1994, in Shkodër, Albania, Hysaj has been a source of national pride as he continues to impress on the international stage.

General_Statistics.short: Hysaj has played 29 games with 24 starts, logging 2031 minutes as a key defender.
General_Statistics.middle: Hysaj has made a significant impact in his 29 game appearances, with 24 of them as starts. He has played a total of 2031 minutes, solidifying his position as a key defender.
General_Statistics.long: With a total of 29 game appearances under his belt, Hysaj has proven himself to be a valuable asset to his team. Of those 29 games, an impressive 24 have been starts, showcasing his importance to the team's success. He has clocked an impressive 2031 minutes on the field, cementing his position as a key defender and demonstrating his dedication to the sport.

Captain_Status.short: Lazio's Hysaj has been playing well, but not as captain.
Captain_Status.middle: Lazio's Albanian defender, Elseid Hysaj, has been putting in a solid performance, but he hasn't been given the captain's armband in any of the games.
Captain_Status.long: While Elseid Hysaj has been a standout player for Lazio, he hasn't been given the responsibility of captaining the team in any of their recent matches.

Substitute_Status.short: Hysaj has been a sub 5 times, taken out 9 times, and on the bench 12 times.
Substitute_Status.middle: Hysaj has seen limited action on the field, serving as a substitute five times and being taken out nine times. He's also spent 12 times on the bench, indicating a lack of playing time.
Substitute_Status.long: Hysaj's playing time has been somewhat limited, as he's been a substitute five times and has been taken out of the game nine times. He's also spent 12 times on the bench, indicating that he's not been getting as much playing time as he might like. Despite this, he remains a valuable member of the team and is ready to contribute when called upon.

Player_Performance.short: Hysaj has had a solid performance so far with 4 shots, 2 on target, and 1 goal scored.
Player_Performance.middle: In terms of his performance, Hysaj has put up some promising numbers, totaling 4 shots with 2 of them being on target. He's managed to score one goal without giving up any. Not bad for a player who's been on the field for a relatively short amount of time.
Player_Performance.long: If we're looking at Hysaj's performance so far, he's had a pretty decent outing. He's managed to rack up 4 shots, with 2 of them being on target, and he's even managed to score one goal without giving up any. That's a solid showing for a player who's only been on the field for a relatively short amount of time. He's definitely making the most of his time out there.

Passes_and_Tackles.short: Hysaj's contributions can't be ignored - 1242 passes, 12 key passes, and a pass accuracy of 37%. Not to mention 46 total tackles, 6 blocked, and 24 interceptions!
Passes_and_Tackles.middle: Hysaj has been a vital asset to his team, showcasing his versatility through 1242 passes, 12 key passes, and a pass accuracy of 37%. He's also made 46 total tackles, with 6 blocked and 24 interceptions, proving his worth in both attack and defense.
Passes_and_Tackles.long: If you're looking for a player who can do it all, look no further than Hysaj. With 1242 passes, 12 key passes, and a pass accuracy of 37%, he's been a driving force in his team's offense. But that's not all - he's also made 46 total tackles, with 6 blocked and 24 interceptions, showcasing his defensive prowess. This guy is a true game-changer.

Duels_and_Dribbles.short: Hysaj's been involved in 179 duels, winning 97, and made 33 dribble attempts with 16 successful ones.
Duels_and_Dribbles.middle: In terms of duels and dribbles, Hysaj's been quite active this season. He's been involved in 179 duels and managed to come out on top 97 times. He's also made 33 dribble attempts, with 16 of them being successful.
Duels_and_Dribbles.long: If you're looking for a player who's been involved in a lot of duels and dribbles this season, look no further than Hysaj. He's been involved in an impressive 179 duels, and managed to emerge victorious 97 times. That's a win rate of over 55%, which is no small feat. He's also been quite adept at dribbling, making 33 attempts and successfully completing 16 of them. That's a success rate of just over 48%, which is respectable to say the least.

Fouls_and_Cards.short: Hysaj has drawn 18 fouls and committed 16, with 3 yellow cards but no red cards.
Fouls_and_Cards.middle: Fullback Hysaj has had a busy game, drawing 18 fouls and committing 16 of his own. He's been given 3 yellow cards, but has managed to avoid a red card so far.
Fouls_and_Cards.long: It's been a busy day for fullback Hysaj, who has found himself in the referee's notebook multiple times. He's drawn 18 fouls and committed 16, earning himself 3 yellow cards. Despite this, he's managed to avoid a red card and keep his record clean. It's a testament to his skill and composure on the field.

Penalty_Status.short: Hysaj has had no luck with penalties so far.
Penalty_Status.middle: Hysaj has had no success with penalty kicks, with none of his shots from the spot being successful or missed.
Penalty_Status.long: It's been a tough day for Hysaj when it comes to penalties. Despite his team's best efforts, he hasn't been able to convert any of his chances from the spot, and none of his shots have been successful or missed. It's a neutral day for him so far, but let's see if he can turn things around in the second half.

Transfer_1.short: Hysaj joins Lazio on a free transfer, another milestone in his career.
Transfer_1.middle: On July 17th, 2021, Hysaj made a stunning move to Lazio on a free transfer, marking another significant achievement in his career. He quickly adapted to the demands of his new club.
Transfer_1.long: On a sunny day in July, the 17th to be exact, Hysaj made a remarkable move to Lazio, joining the team on a free transfer. This transfer marked yet another remarkable milestone in his already illustrious career. With his exceptional skills and adaptability, Hysaj swiftly adjusted to the demands of his new club, ready to take on the challenges that lay ahead.

Transfer_2.short: Hysaj made a significant move to Napoli in 2015 for €6M, adapting to high pressure and expectations.
Transfer_2.middle: In 2015, Hysaj made a notable transfer from Empoli to Napoli for a fee of €6M, marking a pivotal moment in his career as he learned to navigate the demands of a top-tier team.

news.Messi erstmals vertragslos \u2013 Abl\u0:
Sure! Here are three outputs in different lengths with a neutral flavor:

Short:
Lionel Messi's contract with FC Barcelona has expired, making him the most valuable free agent in Transfermarkt history. Talks with Barcelona are ongoing, but his future remains uncertain.

Middle:
Lionel Messi's contract with FC Barcelona has officially expired, and while it's possible he may remain with the club, there's also a chance he could move to another team. Reporter Alfredo Martínez notes that talks with Barcelona are progressing well, but Messi has yet to confirm his future. Paris Saint-Germain has been linked to a move for Messi, and other high-value players like Sergio Ramos and Jérôme Boateng remain uncertain.

Long:
As of July 1, 2021, Lionel Messi's contract with FC Barcelona has officially expired, making him the most valuable free agent in Transfermarkt history. While it appears that the 34-year-old Argentinian may ultimately remain with his boyhood club, it's still theoretically possible that Messi could change teams on a free transfer. Reporter Alfredo Martínez notes that talks between Messi's father Jorge and the management of Barcelona, led by President Joan Laporta, are currently progressing well. However, Messi, currently participating in Copa América with Argentina, hasn't confirmed his future yet. Notably, Paris Saint-Germain has been frequently linked with a move for Messi. The most plausible scenario appears to be Messi signing a two-year extension with Barcelona, potentially followed by a move to Major League Soccer. This possibility seems even more likely with the free transfer signing of his best friend Sergio Agüero from Manchester City, along with other significant signings including Memphis Depay aimed at boosting the competitiveness of Barcelona on the international stage. Meanwhile, the futures of other high-value players like Sergio Ramos and Jérôme Boateng, who can now sign with a new club for free, remain uncertain. On a related note, Gianluigi Donnarumma, the second most valuable player whose contract has also expired, is expected to join PSG from AC Milan after the European Championship ends. Towards the end, Santos Borré is seemingly on the verge of transferring from River Plate to Eintracht Frankfurt.

news.Sarri schl\u00e4gt Mourinho im Derby del: {"short": "Naples continues unbeaten streak, leads Serie A with Osimhen and Insigne. Juventus climbs to 9th with win over Sampdoria, but Dybala's injury is a concern. Lazio triumphs over Roma in city derby with Sarri's strategy and Milinković-Savić's goals.", "middle": "SSC Naples maintains its flawless record in Serie A with a 2-0 victory against Cagliari Calcio, thanks to top scorers Victor Osimhen and Lorenzo Insigne. This puts them ahead of AC Milan and sets the stage for an exciting championship. Juventus, meanwhile, climbs to the ninth position after a 3-2 win over Sampdoria, but Paulo Dybala's injury may be a setback for their upcoming Champions League match against FC Chelsea. In the city derby, Lazio triumphed over AS Roma with a close 3-2 win, thanks to new coaches Maurizio Sarri and José Mourinho and goals from Sergej Milinković-Savić and former AS attacker Pedro. The clash of new trainers delivered an exciting show, with Sarri's strategy and player performance ultimately securing the win for Lazio, moving them to sixth place on the table, just one point behind fourth-placed AS Roma.", "long": "SSC Naples continues to dominate the Italian Serie A with an unbeaten streak, thanks to the top-notch performance of their top scorers Victor Osimhen and Lorenzo Insigne. Their 2-0 victory against Cagliari Calcio has placed them ahead of AC Milan, and with this flawless record, they are setting the stage for an exciting championship. Juventus, on the other hand, has climbed to the ninth position after a thrilling 3-2 win over Sampdoria, but the injury of Paulo Dybala may be a setback for their upcoming Champions League match against FC Chelsea. The excitement continues in the city derby, where Lazio triumphed over AS Roma with a close 3-2 win, thanks to the strategic genius of new coaches Maurizio Sarri and José Mourinho and the goals of Sergej Milinković-Savić and former AS attacker Pedro. The clash of new trainers delivered an exciting show, with Sarri's strategy and player performance ultimately securing the win for Lazio, moving them to sixth place on the table, just one point behind fourth-placed AS Roma. This is a testament to the strength and competitiveness of the Italian Serie A, with teams constantly pushing each other to new heights."}

Immobile was driving his car with his two daughters in the car when the accident occurred, according to a Fire Department spokesperson. His eldest daughter was taken to the same hospital as her father for checks, while his youngest daughter was taken to a children's hospital, reported Ansa news agency. Immobile suffered whiplash and a broken rib on his right side, with his condition currently good but uncertain how long he'll be out. The tram driver was also injured in the accident, with images circulating Italian media showing a damaged vehicle front and derailed tram. Some passengers were taken to hospital for checks. Professor Stefano Lovati from Paideia Hospital in Rome stated that Immobile's fracture is minor and will be treated with rest and anti-inflammatory drugs, but if it's a complete fracture, it's very painful and it takes two weeks before you can be fully active in sports again. The police have not initially provided any details about the cause of the accident, with a spokesperson for the transportation company "Atac" unable to provide any information either."}

The Bundesliga has also reported a case with Luca Kilian from SC Paderborn, and two unnamed players and coaches from Eintracht Frankfurt. This situation continues to develop, with updates being provided regularly."}

This is largely due to the incredible performance of top scorer Lautaro Martínez, who has increased in value by a whopping 15 million to 100 million euros. The Argentinian captain has been on fire this season, scoring 11 goals in the first ten games, and his value has skyrocketed as a result. Other players who have contributed to Inter Milan's rising market value include Davide Frattesi, Federico Dimarco, and former Gladbach player Marcus Thuram, who has accumulated ten scorer points in his first ten matches. On the other hand, AS Roma has seen a significant decrease in market value due to injuries and poor performance, with a drop of about 19 million euros. The team's captain, Lorenzo Pellegrini, has also seen a decline in his value, as well as former Bundesliga players Malick Thiaw and Marcus Thuram. Despite this, Inter Milan's rise to the top of the market value charts is a testament to the team's talent and potential for success this season."}

Sure! Here are three outputs in different lengths with a neutral flavor:

Short:
Serie A's market value update sets a new record with squad value gains for Champions League finalists Inter Milan and SSC Napoli. Napoli broke the €640 million mark for the first time since pre-corona times with an €11.5 million increase, while Inter Milan follows Udinese Calcio as the second-biggest winner in the Italian top flight with an increase of around €22 million to €556.4 million.

Medium:
The latest Serie A market value update has set a new record, with squad value gains for Champions League finalists Inter Milan and SSC Napoli. Napoli reached the €640 million mark for the first time since pre-corona times with an €11.5 million increase, while Inter Milan follows Udinese Calcio as the second-biggest winner in the Italian top flight with an increase of around €22 million to €556.4 million.

Long:
The latest update on Serie A's market value has set a new record, with squad value gains for Champions League finalists Inter Milan and SSC Napoli. Napoli reached the €640 million mark for the first time since pre-corona times with an €11.5 million increase, while Inter Milan follows Udinese Calcio as the second-biggest winner in the Italian top flight with an increase of around €22 million to €556.4 million. Significant changes are seen in the top goalkeeper market value ranking, with Milan's Mike Maignan (27) remaining at the front but advancing to the world top after an increase of €10 million to €45 million. Inter goalkeeper Andre Onana's (27) value also rises sharply by €15 million to €35 million, making him on par with Gregor Kobel (25) or the older Jan Oblak (30) and Marc-Andre ter Stegen (31). However, there are also significant downgrades, with Lazio Rome's midfielder Sergej Milinkovic-Savic (28) and current Inter defender Milan Skriniar (28) having their values reduced by €10 million to €50 million. Juventus striker Federico Chiesa (25), whose season was miserable, is also devalued by €10 million to €40 million. On the other hand, Hakan Calhanoglu (29) receives an increase of €5 million to €40 million after a strong development in the unfamiliar position as a playmaker before the defensive line. Victor Osimhen, the Serie A top scorer, increases his market value again, this time by €20 million to €120 million, making him the most valuable player in the Serie A.

news.Marktwertupdate: Serie-A-Rekord f\u00fcr: {"short": "Serie A teams see record market value with Inter Milan and Napoli leading the way. Kvaratskhelia earns individual trophies but his value decreases due to contract duration. Mike Maignan and André Onana lead the goalkeeper market value ranking.", "middle": "Serie A has achieved a record market value, with Inter Milan and Napoli driving the growth. Napoli's market value surpasses 640 million euros for the first time since pre-Corona period. Kvaratskhelia earns individual trophies but his value decreases due to contract duration. Mike Maignan and André Onana lead the goalkeeper market value ranking.", "long": "Serie A has set a new record for market value, with Inter Milan and Napoli taking the lead. Napoli's market value has reached an all-time high of over 640 million euros, while Inter Milan's value has increased by approximately 22 million euros to 556.4 million euros. This places Inter narrowly ahead of AC Milan in the squad value ranking. Kvaratskhelia, a key player for Napoli, has earned individual trophies but his market value has decreased due to his long contract duration. In the goalkeeper market value ranking, Mike Maignan and André Onana have seen significant increases, with Maignan now leading the ranking at 45 million euros. However, there have also been downgrades for players like Sergej Milinkovic-Savic and Milan Skriniar, with both experiencing a decrease of 10 million euros. Victor Osimhen, the Serie A top scorer, has increased his market value again by 20 million euros to 120 million euros, becoming the most valuable player in Serie A history."}
news.Marktwerte Italien: Osimhen knackt 100-M: {"short": "Serie A squad values update: Napoli leads, Vlahovic struggles, young players shine", "middle": "Napoli tops the Serie A squad value ranking with a value of 629 million euros, thanks to top scorer Victor Osimhen and teammate Khvicha Kvaratskhelia. Vlahovic's form has been a concern, while young players like Rasmus Højlund, Nicolò Fagioli, and Malick Thiaw have seen significant increases in value. Paul Pogba and Romelu Lukaku have suffered a drop in value.", "long": "The latest Serie A squad value update has brought some surprises, with Napoli taking the lead and Victor Osimhen breaking the 100-million-euro mark. However, Juventus striker Vlahovic's form has been a concern, and young players like Rasmus Højlund, Nicolò Fagioli, and Malick Thiaw have stolen the spotlight. Paul Pogba and Romelu Lukaku have seen a drop in value, while Manchester United, Liverpool, and PSG are considered the top contenders for Osimhen's transfer in the summer, should he decide to leave."}

news.3. Maldini-Generation trifft f\u00fcr AC: {"short": "AC Milan's Daniel Maldini scores on debut, Inter and Atalanta draw, and Genoa and Hellas Verona share points in a thrilling day of Serie A football.", "middle": "In an action-packed day of Serie A matches, AC Milan's 19-year-old debutant Daniel Maldini made his mark with a goal in their 2:1 win over Spezia Calcio. Inter Milan and Atalanta played to a 2:2 draw, while Genoa CFC and Hellas Verona shared the points in a thrilling 3:3 draw. The day's highlights included a brace from Mattia Destro of Genoa, who scored one goal while holding a water bottle.", "long": "It was an exhilarating day of Serie A football, with AC Milan's Daniel Maldini making his debut a memorable one by scoring the opening goal in their 2:1 victory over Spezia Calcio. The 19-year-old son of club legend Paolo Maldini showed his skill and poise on the pitch, setting the stage for a thrilling match. In another closely contested match, Inter Milan and Atalanta played to a 2:2 draw, with Lautaro Martínez putting Inter ahead early, but goals from Ruslan Malinovskyi and Rafael Toloi turning the tide before half-time. Inter's Edin Dzeko managed to pull back a goal in the second half, but it wasn't enough to secure the win. The match between Genoa CFC and Hellas Verona was a six-goal spectacle, with Verona initially leading 2:0 thanks to goals from Giovanni Simeone and Antonin Barak. However, a late rally from the home side in the last 15 minutes, with goals from Domenico Criscito and a brace from Mattia Destro, resulted in a feverish 3:3 draw. The highlight of the match was Destro's second goal, which he scored while holding a water bottle, much to the delight of the crowd. However, the points were shared when Nikola Kalinic scored for Verona in stoppage time, making the final score 3:3."}

Personal Information.short: S. Pioli, an experienced Italian coach from Parma, born in 1965.
Personal Information.middle: Stefano Pioli, or S. Pioli as he's known in the football world, is an Italian coach from Parma, Italy. Born on October 20th, 1965, he's 58 years old and has been representing Italy in the global football scene for decades.
Personal Information.long: Get ready to meet Stefano Pioli, a seasoned Italian coach from the charming city of Parma, Italy. Born on October 20th, 1965, this football mastermind is 58 years young and proudly represents his Italian heritage in the global football scene. With a career spanning decades, S. Pioli has made a name for himself as a highly experienced and skilled coach, known for his dedication to the beautiful game.

Previous Teams.short: Pioli has coached many successful teams throughout his career, showcasing his tactical brilliance.
Previous Teams.middle: Stefano Pioli has an impressive coaching history, leading teams such as Fiorentina, Inter Milan, and Lazio to success. He has also had successful stints with several other clubs, demonstrating his versatility and tactical prowess.
Previous Teams.long: Stefano Pioli is a highly respected coach with an extensive and impressive coaching history. He has led numerous teams to success throughout his career, showcasing his tactical brilliance and versatility. From Fiorentina and Inter Milan to Lazio, he has made a significant impact at each of his coaching stops. Additionally, he has had successful stints with a variety of other clubs, including Bologna, Palermo, Chievo, Sassuolo, Piacenza, Grosseto, Parma, Modena, and Salernitana. Pioli's ability to adapt and succeed with a range of teams is a testament to his coaching skills and dedication to the sport.

Career Overview.short: Pioli, a seasoned football coach, has a proven track record of success in Italy's top tier teams.
Career Overview.middle: With over a decade of coaching experience in Italy's top football leagues, Stefano Pioli has established himself as a skilled strategist and leader in the sport. From Modena to Salernitana and currently with AC Milan, Pioli has consistently demonstrated his ability to motivate and lead his teams to success.
Career Overview.long: Stefano Pioli's coaching career spans over a decade of success in Italy's top football leagues. Starting with Modena in June 2004 and Salernitana in July 2003, Pioli has honed his skills as a strategist and leader, earning a reputation as one of the most adept coaches in the sport. His extensive experience with top-tier teams is a testament to his prowess and ability to consistently deliver results. As the current coach of AC Milan, Pioli continues to demonstrate his expertise and dedication to the sport.

information.short: AC Milan wins against Lazio in a thrilling match at the Stadio Giuseppe Meazza on September 12th.
information.middle: AC Milan dominated the game against Lazio, scoring 2 goals and keeping their opponents scoreless. The match, refereed by D. Chiffi, was part of the Regular Season's 3rd Round and ended with a final score of 2-0. The crowd was deafening as AC Milan emerged victorious.
information.long: The 12th of September at the Stadio Giuseppe Meazza was a day to remember for AC Milan fans as their team emerged victorious in an exhilarating match against Lazio. The crowd was electric as the two teams took to the field, and the energy only intensified as the game progressed. AC Milan was in command from the start, scoring 2 goals and keeping their opponents silent. The referee, D. Chiffi, did an excellent job in keeping the game fair and exciting. By halftime, Milan was already leading 1-0, and they sealed their triumph with the same figure at full time. The final score was 2-0, leaving Lazio fans disappointed but the AC Milan supporters elated. It was an action-packed 90 minutes, and the match has officially finished. A thrilling day for AC Milan fans and a tough loss for Lazio.
